datafield.subfield: Sound recordings and other material from the Zbigniew Brzezinski papers,
Zbigniew Brzezinski papers, sound recordings and other material from the papers,

@alpha_character^b^@alpha_srt^brzezinski, zbigniew^@title^Sound recordings and other material from the Zbigniew Brzezinski papers^@href^http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.mbrsrs/eadmbrs.rs009003^@aggregate^rs^@ead_file_name^rs009003.xml^@eadid^rs009003^
33 sound recordings, including sound tape reels, sound cassettes, microcassettes, and sound discs

Sound recordings of interviews, speeches, memorandums, television news, and diaries of Zbigniew Brzezinski. The recorded interviews and speeches are accompanied in several instances by transcripts and other supplementary material. These materials are part of the Zbigniew Brzezinski papers, which are held by the Manuscript Division of the Library of Congress.
Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Sound recordings and other material from the Zbigniew Brzezinski papers circa 1979-2008 1979-1997

physdesc.label: Extent (Sound Recordings)
physdesc.extent: 33 sound recordings, including sound tape reels, sound cassettes, microcassettes, and sound discs

did.langmaterial: Collection materials are predominantly in English; materials in Russian are indicated in the container inventory.

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Recorded Sound Reference Center, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division Library of Congress

did.abstract: Sound recordings of interviews, speeches, memorandums, television news, and diaries of Zbigniew Brzezinski. The recorded interviews and speeches are accompanied in several instances by transcripts and other supplementary material. These materials are part of the Zbigniew Brzezinski papers, which are held by the Manuscript Division of the Library of Congress.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

acqinfo.head: Collection Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, 2009.

accruals.head: Additions
accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by David Jackson in 2009.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Restrictions may exist on copying, quoting, or publishing materials included in the collection. For additional information, contact a reference librarian in the Recorded Sound Reference Center, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707-7833.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Advance notice is required; contact a reference librarian in the Recorded Sound Reference Center, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress, Washington, DC, 20540-4690; (202) 707-7833.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [Container number, eg., Box 3], or [Audio tape number, eg., RYB 2480], Sound Recordings and Other Material from the Zbigniew Brzezinski Papers, Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Foreign policy advisor, political scientist, educator, and author. Full name: Zbigniew Kazimierz Brzezinski.

Born in Warsaw, Poland, on March 28, 1928, Zbigniew Brzezinski moved with his family to Canada in 1938 and became a naturalized citizen of the United States in 1958. Dr. Brzezinski served as instructor and assistant professor at Harvard, 1953-1960, and as assistant professor and professor at Columbia University, 1962-1977. While still at Columbia, he served as the first director of the Trilateral Commission from 1973 until 1976, which led to his position as foreign policy advisor to the Jimmy Carter presidential campaign. From 1977 until 1981, Brzezinski served as national security advisor within the Carter administration. He returned to his professorship at Columbia in 1981 and continued there until moving to Johns Hopkins University in 1989. In 1981, Brzezinski also accepted a position as counselor at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Carter Administration series consists of recorded speeches and interviews, accompanying transcripts, and other material related to Brzezinski's tenure as national security advisor in President Jimmy Carter's administration.

The Speeches, Testimony, and Travel series consists of post-1981 recorded speeches and interviews, diaries, accompanying transcripts, and other material concerning Brzezinski's domestic and foreign speaking engagements, and travel.

The Subject File series consists of post-1981 recorded interviews with print and broadcast media sources, episodes from the NPR radio program on which Brzezinski occasionally guested, America Abroad, including the non-broadcast pilot program, and recorded instructions by Brzezinski to his secretary, Trudy Werner. Also included are recorded interviews with authors Tom Hayden and Sally Quinn, which were included with the Zbigniew Brzezinski Papers.
The Supplementary Material series consists of cover letters and published editions of speeches that supplement the sound recordings in the collection.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection materials are arranged in 4 series:

did.unittitle: Series 1. Carter Administration, 1979-1981

scopecontent.p: Recorded speeches and interviews, accompanying transcripts, and other material related to Brzezinski's tenure as national security advisor in the Carter administration.

did.unittitle: Compilation of news about Billy Carter, 1980-07-14 to 1980-07-25

scopecontent.p: Compilation of news broadcasts concerning the scandal involving Billy Carter's alleged connections to the Libyan government.

did.unittitle: Interview with Zbigniew Brzezinski for ABC News, 1979-03-23

note.p: Interview conducted by Ted Koppel, ABC News.

scopecontent.p: Zbigniew Brzezinski discusses world security issues, with particular emphasis on U.S.-Soviet relations.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the interview, 1979-03-23
Transcript of the interview, undated

note.p: A cover letter is appended to the transcript.

did.unittitle: Interview with Zbigniew Brzezinski, MacNeil/Lehrer Report, 1980-10-15

scopecontent.p: Zbigniew Brzezinski discusses events in the Middle East, including the Iran-Iraq War and the role of the Soviet Union in the region, on the MacNeil/Lehrer Report, WETA-TV.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the interview, 1980-10-15
did.physdesc: 1 sound cassette (26 minutes) : analog, 2.4 cm./second, mono ; 1-7/8 x 1 inches

note.p: Label from original container: "McNeil/Lehrer - WETA (Wed., Oct. 15, 1980) ; Tape not erased."

did.unittitle: Transcript of the interview, undated

note.p: A cover letter is appended to the transcript.

did.unittitle: Remarks by President Jimmy Carter at the Presidential Medal of Freedom ceremony, 1981-01-16

scopecontent.p: President Jimmy Carter awards the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Harold Brown, Zbigniew Brzezinski, Warren Christopher, Walter Cronkite, Kirk Douglas, Margaret Craig McNamara, Karl Menninger, Edmund S. Muskie, Esther Peterson, Gerard C. Smith, Robert S. Strauss, Elbert Tuttle, Earl Warren, Andrew Young, and, via proxy, Roger Baldwin.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the speech, 1981-01-16
Transcript of the speech, undated

Sound recording of the speech, 1979-12-18
Series 2. Speeches, Testimony, and Travel, 1983-2007

note.p: Typewritten on cassette label: "KIV-55-Brzezinski."

did.unittitle: Excerpts of Zbigniew Brzezinski comments on U.S.-Russian relations, Liberty Live, Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, 1996-05-14
did.langmaterial: Recording is in Russian, with short excerpts in English.

"The New Frontier of Politics, the New Dimension of Ethics," 1994-10

scopecontent.p: Zbigniew Brzezinski speech on the dehumanizing effects of the scientific revolution on culture, at the Geopolitics and Human Progress Conference (2nd Symposium sur la santé positive), Montreal, Canada.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the speech, 1994-10
Transcript of the speech, undated
Zbigniew Brzezinski diary and instructions to his secretary, 1987-05-12 to1987-05-22
did.physdesc: 1 sound cassette (1 hour, 5 minutes) : analog, 2.4 cm./second, mono ; 1-7/8 x 1 inches

scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of Brzezinski dictating a travel diary for his trip to Hungary and Poland during the inclusive dates.

note.p: Label from original container: "Hungary - Poland ; May 12-22 1987."

did.unittitle: Zbigniew Brzezinski remarks on managing NATO enlargement at the United States Institute of Peace working group on European security, 1997-03-05
Sound recording of the remarks, 1997-03-05

note.p: Supplementary material: Cover letter addressed from Lauren Van Metre to Trudy (Werner) and photocopy of original cassette container label. See Box 1, Folder 8.

did.unittitle: Zbigniew Brzezinski speech on Solidarity in Poland, circa 1982

scopecontent.p: Zbigniew Brzezinski discusses the Solidarity movement in Poland, the imposition of martial law in Poland by the Soviet Union, and the imposition of economic sanctions by the United States.

did.physdesc: 1 sound cassette (1 hour, 2 minutes) : analog, 2.4 cm./second, mono ; 1-7/8 x 1 inches

scopecontent.p: Speech given as a luncheon address at Democracy and the Rule of Law: A Tribute to Ambassador Max M. Kampelman, a conference co-sponsored by the American Bar Association Standing Committee on Law and National Security and the Center for National Security Law, December 2-3, 1993.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the speech, 1993-12

did.unittitle: Zbigniew Brzezinski instructions to his secretary, circa 1983
did.physdesc: 1 sound cassette (approximately 12 minutes) : analog, 2.4 cm./second, mono ; 1-7/8 x 1 inches

scopecontent.p: Zbigniew Brzezinski gives instructions to his secretary and dictates various letters. Refers to an Arabic translation of the Zbigniew Brzezinski book, Power and Principle, and includes instructions to send advance copies to various dignitaries.

did.unittitle: Zbigniew Brzezinski instructions to his secretary, circa 1986
did.physdesc: 1 sound cassette (approximately 9 minutes) : analog, 2.4 cm./second, mono ; 1-7/8 x 1 inches

scopecontent.p: Brzezinski gives instructions to send promotional pamphlets and advance copies of his book on U.S.-Soviet relations, Game Plan, to various dignitaries, with dictated cover letters to President Ronald Reagan and John Poindexter.

did.unittitle: Series 4. Supplementary Material, 1983-2008

scopecontent.p: Consists of cover letters, notes, and published editions of speeches that supplement the sound recordings in the collection.

arrangement.p: These items are arranged according to the order of the materials in Series 1-3 to which they relate.

separatedmaterial.head: Transferred Material
separatedmaterial.p: One recording on DVD recordable disc, containing a 4:40-minute movie commemorating the 60th anniversary of the National Security Council, was transferred to the Moving Image Section of the Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division, Library of Congress, on November 19, 2009.

mets:div.LABEL: Sound recordings and other material from the Zbigniew Brzezinski papers circa 1979-2008 1979-1997
